Zestymath
About Cheat Sheets Math

Welcome to Multi-Variable and Vector Calculus. This is a really exciting subject and is the first step into allowing one to tackle real world physics and engineering problems.

This course is a work in progress. The goal is for it to be finished by the end of December 2018.

Introduction - What is Multivariable Calculus?

  • Unit 1 - Introduction to 3D Space and Vectors
    1. Higher Dimensional Coordinate Systems
    2. Vectors and their Geometry
    3. Algebraic Operations with Vectors
    4. Norm
    5. Dot Product
    6. Cross Product and Determinant
    7. Equations of Lines
    8. Equations of Planes
    9. Quadric Surfaces
  • Unit 2 - Plane and Space Curves
    1. Parametric Equations
    2. Differentiation of Curves
    3. Arc Length
    4. Curvature and Torsion
    5. Frenet-Serret Equations
  • Unit 3 - Partial Differentiation
    1. Functions of Multiple Variables
    2. Contour Plots and Level Sets
    3. Limits and Continuity*
    4. Partial Differentiation
    5. Tangent Planes and Linear Approximations
    6. Chain Rule
    7. Directional Derivative
    8. Extrema 1
    9. Extrema 2
    10. Lagrange Multipliers 1
    11. Lagrange Multipliers 2
    12. Bordered Hessian*
    13. Taylor Series*
    14. Lagrange Remainder*
    15. The Jacobian Derivative
  • Unit 4 - Multiple Integration
    1. Riemann Sums
    2. Double Integral over a Rectangle
    3. Double Integral over General Plane Region
    4. Double Integral in Polar Coordinates
    5. Surface Area
    6. Triple Integrals
    7. Triple Integrals in Cylindrical Coordinates
    8. Triple Integrals in Spherical Coordinates
    9. Change of Variables
    10. Applications
  • Unit 5 - Vector Calculus
    1. Vector Fields
    2. Line Integrals
    3. Fundamental Theorem of Line Integrals
    4. Green's Theorem
    5. Divergence and Curl
    6. Laplacian
    7. Surface Integrals
    8. Stokes Theorem
    9. Divergence Theorem
    10. Applications
    11. Maxwell's Equations
    12. Differential Forms*
  • Supplementary Material
    1. Change of Coordinates
    2. Curvilinear Coordinates
    3. Notation

Sources

  1. Calculus - 7 ed. Stewart, James (2012)
  2. Vector Analysis - Spiegel, Murray R. (1959)
  3. Differential Geometry of Curves and Surfaces - 2 ed. do Carmo, Manfredo (2017)
